gui

Interface ControllableView

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    View

    public interface ControllableView
    This interface provides a uniform API for any GUI views that need to be modified abstractly by a controller. The methods provided here allow for a controller to manipulate any view without needed detailed information on the view, as such information is contained within the implementation of this interface.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Craig

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void changeViewProperty(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent event)
      Passes a PropertyChangeEvent to this view to update a property being displayed in the GUI.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getViewPropertyValues()
      Returns a Map with the values of this view's properties keyed to the appropriate property name constants.
      void invokeControllerAction(java.lang.String actionCommand)
      Passes action information on to a controller that this view has a reference of.

    • Method Detail

      • changeViewProperty

        void changeViewProperty(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent event)
        Passes a PropertyChangeEvent to this view to update a property being displayed in the GUI. Implementations of this method should use conditional logic to test the property name to see if it applies to this view and what action to take. If the property passed to this view does not apply to it, simple ignore the event.
        Parameters:
        event - the PropertyChangeEvent being passed to this view.

      • getViewPropertyValues

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getViewPropertyValues()
        Returns a Map with the values of this view's properties keyed to the appropriate property name constants. Implementations of this method should use an external class containing a constant String value for each property name as the keys to ensure consistency throughout the program.
        Returns:
        a Map with property values linked to String keys.

      • invokeControllerAction

        void invokeControllerAction(java.lang.String actionCommand)
        Passes action information on to a controller that this view has a reference of. Implementations may vary based on the design of the controller being used with this view. However, generally this method will be implemented by instantiating a subclass of AWTEvent with the implementation of this interface as its source class, storing the value of the actionCommand parameter in it, and passing the event and any needed values from the view to the controller via an event handling method. TODO figure out an alternate implemenation of this method for passing ItemEvents along to the controller.
        Parameters:
        actionCommand - a description of the event that has taken place. To maintain a simple, abstract relationship with this view, this parameter should be a constant value stored in a separate class.
